RESOURCE.DESCRIPTION: Common Metadata for simple/advance query (must/should parameters)

PARAM.name: INPUT:POS
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Search Position in the form "ra,dec" where ra and dec are given in decimal degrees in the ICRS coordinate system. Example (10,41)

PARAM.name: INPUT:SIZE
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Size of search region in the RA and DEC coordinates (decimal degrees)

PARAM.name: INPUT:APERTURE
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Used only for spectral extraction. The aperture is specified as a diameter in decimal degrees

PARAM.name: INPUT:BAND
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: For a numerical bandpass the units are wavelength in vacuum in units of meters (1E-7/3E-6;source)

PARAM.name: INPUT:COLLECTION
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The IVOA identifier or "shorName" of a data collection as defined by the service, for example SDSS-DR2 or NRAO-VLA

PARAM.name: INPUT:COMPRESS
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If this flag is present, datasets returned may optionally be returned to the client in compressed form. Valid values are "true" and "false"

PARAM.name: INPUT:CREATORDID
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: An IVOA dataset identifier, assigned at creation time by the creator of the parent data collection. Example: ivo://nrao.edu/via#1998s2/4992a

PARAM.name: INPUT:FLUXCALIB
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the minimum level of flux calibration for acceptable data. Possible values are "absolute", "relative" and "any" (the default)

PARAM.name: INPUT:FORMAT
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Requested format for the output table (all, compliant, native, graphic, votable, fits, xml, metadata)

PARAM.name: INPUT:MAXREC
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of records to be returned

PARAM.name: INPUT:MTIME
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Find only datasets modified, created or deleted in the given range of dates

PARAM.name: INPUT:PUBDID
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The IVOA publisher's dataset identifier, assigned by the publisher of a dataset

PARAM.name: INPUT:REDSHIFT
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A photometric (observed) redshift range. Example 1.2/3

PARAM.name: INPUT:REDSHIFTL
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: REDSHIFTL

PARAM.name: INPUT:RUNID
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Opaque string used to associate multiple service invocations in service logs, e.g. to identify them as all belonging to the same job or application.

PARAM.name: INPUT:SNR
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The minimum signal-to-noise ratio of a candidate dataset

PARAM.name: INPUT:SPECRP
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The minimum spectral resolution, specified as the spectral resolving power /d in dimensional units

PARAM.name: INPUT:SPATRES
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The minimum spatial resolution, specified in decimal degrees

PARAM.name: INPUT:TARGETCLASS
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Types of astronomical objects (star, galaxy, pulsar, PN, AGN, QSO, GRB

PARAM.name: INPUT:TIME
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: the time coverage specified in range-list form.

PARAM.name: INPUT:TIMERES
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The minimum time resolution, specified in seconds.

PARAM.name: INPUT:TOP
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Limits the number of returned records in the query response table

PARAM.name: INPUT:WAVECALIB
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the minimum level of spectral coordinate calibration for acceptable data. Possible values are "absolute", "relative", "any" (the default)

PARAM.name: INPUT:VARAMPL
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The acceptable range of variability amplitude, specified as a single element open or closed range-list, with values in the range 0.0 to 1.0
